comment:
* An event describing a touchscreen interaction originating from a remote device.
 *
 * The pointer id, tool type, action, and location are required; pressure and main axis size are
 * optional.
 *
 * Note: A VirtualTouchEvent with ACTION_CANCEL can only be created with TOOL_TYPE_PALM (and vice
 * versa). Events are injected into the uinput kernel module, which has no concept of cancelling
 * an action. The only way to state the intention that a pointer should not be handled as a pointer
 * is to change its tool type to TOOL_TYPE_PALM.
 *
 * @hide

variables.name: TOOL_TYPE_FINGER
variables.comment: Tool type indicating that the user's finger is the origin of the event.

variables.name: TOOL_TYPE_PALM
variables.comment:
* Tool type indicating that a user's palm (or other input mechanism to be rejected) is the
     * origin of the event.

variables.name: ACTION_DOWN
variables.comment: Action indicating the tool has been pressed down to the touchscreen.

variables.name: ACTION_UP
variables.comment: Action indicating the tool has been lifted from the touchscreen.

variables.name: ACTION_MOVE
variables.comment: Action indicating the tool has been moved along the face of the touchscreen.

variables.name: ACTION_CANCEL
variables.comment: Action indicating the tool cancelled the current movement.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
public int getPointerId()
methods.comment: * Returns the pointer id associated with this event.

methods.name: public int getToolType()
methods.comment: * Returns the tool type associated with this event.

methods.name: public int getAction()
methods.comment: * Returns the action associated with this event.

methods.name: public float getX()
methods.comment: * Returns the x-axis location associated with this event.

methods.name: public float getY()
methods.comment: * Returns the y-axis location associated with this event.

methods.name: public float getPressure()
methods.comment: * Returns the pressure associated with this event. Returns {@link Float#NaN} if omitted.

methods.name: public float getMajorAxisSize()
methods.comment: * Returns the major axis size associated with this event. Returns {@link Float#NaN} if omitted.

methods.name: public long getEventTimeNanos()
methods.comment:
* Returns the time this event occurred, in the {@link SystemClock#uptimeMillis()} time base but
     * with nanosecond (instead of millisecond) precision.
     *
     * @see InputEvent#getEventTime()

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
